text: The Ginza Line (銀座線, ぎんざせん, Ginza-sen) is the oldest metro line of Tokyo Metro in Tokyo, Japan. It was built in the 1920s and 1930s. == Station == Station Japanese Transfers Location G-01 Shibuya 渋谷 * Tokyo Metro: ** ○Hanzōmon Line (Z-01)* ** ○Fukutoshin Line(F-16) * East Japan Railway Company ** Yamanote Line ** Saikyō Line ** Shōnan-Shinjuku Line * Tokyu Corporation ** Den-en- toshi Line* ** Tōyoko Line * Keiō: Inokashira Line * *The Ginza and Hanzōmon/Den-en-toshi lines at Shibuya are far apart, thus transfer is announced at Omotesandō Shibuya G-02 Omotesandō 表参道 * Tokyo Metro: ** ○Chiyoda Line (C-04) ** ○Hanzōmon Line (Z-02, cross-platform interchange) Minato G-03 Gaienmae 外苑前 G-04 Aoyama-itchōme 青山一丁目 * Tokyo Metro: ○Hanzōmon Line (Z-03) * Toei: ○Ōedo Line (E-24) G-05 Akasaka-mitsuke 赤坂見附 * Tokyo Metro: ○Marunouchi Line (M-13, cross-platform interchange) At Nagatachō: *
